hero.headline: Claude Code Comes to Slack: Anthropic's $1B Milestone as AI Moves Into Team Workflows
hero.summary: Anthropic is launching Claude Code directly in Slack, enabling developers to delegate coding tasks from chat threads. Tag @Claude to spin up coding sessions using Slack context—bug reports, feature requests, conversation history—and watch as Claude posts progress updates and opens PRs. The timing coincides with Claude Code hitting $1 billion in annualized revenue, just six months after GA.
hero.whyItMatters: This isn't just another Slack bot. Claude Code in Slack represents the next frontier: AI agents that live where developers already collaborate. By reading thread context to understand intent, automatically selecting repos, and posting updates asynchronously, Anthropic is betting that the best AI UX is invisible—embedded in existing workflows rather than requiring context-switching to new tools.

topStories.title: Anthropic Engineers Use Claude in 60% of Work, Report 50% Productivity Gains
topStories.summary: A new study of 132 Anthropic engineers reveals that staff use Claude in approximately 60% of their daily work, self-reporting productivity gains of about 50%. More notably, Claude Code is being trusted to handle increasingly complex workflows with less human oversight.

topStories.title: Context Engineering Emerges as the New Paradigm Beyond Prompt Engineering
topStories.summary: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the frontier of AI control. Instead of clever wording, engineers now design environments where AI thinks with depth, consistency, and purpose—building frameworks that maintain meaning through memory, metadata, and structure.

topStories.title: We Need To Talk About AI Agent Architectures
topStories.summary: A deep dive into emerging frameworks and cloud hosting options for AI agents. As coding agents mature, the infrastructure choices—multi-agent systems, orchestration patterns, and execution environments—become critical differentiators.

topStories.title: Experimental MCP-CLI Mode Slashes Claude Code Token Usage by 80%
topStories.summary: Anthropic quietly released an experimental feature that dramatically reduces MCP token consumption. Set ENABLE_EXPERIMENTAL_MCP_CLI=true and MCP tools load on-demand via mcp-cli commands instead of upfront—dropping context usage from 63% to 11% in real-world tests. Power users with multiple MCP servers can reclaim over 100k tokens.

notableQuotes.quote: Instead of loading full tool definitions into the system prompt, MCP-CLI provides Claude with minimal metadata about each server and its tools. When Claude needs detailed information about a specific tool, it can request it on-demand. Claude can pipe large outputs directly to files or process them with tools like jq, keeping bulky data out of context.
